title: Have you ever regretted saying hi to someone? - Quora

response.answer_text: Oh, my. I ran into an acquaintence at the grocery store one day and casually asked “How are you?”. I found myself listening to a long, very exhaustive complaint about how horribly badly her life has turned out and about how unfair the government is and how she hates her job and can’t survive on her income, blah, blah, blah. I was literally stunned into silence.

Yes. I kindly said hi to someone on my dog walk as I normally do to people I pass. I got a snarky reply back and decided in a 10’th of a second he wasn’t worth the effort of an argument or even a reply back. The day was too good to waste it on an idiot.

I met a man walking a puppy in front of my sister’s house yesterday. We had a long conversation about life, math, heaven, and the book he wrote. When I found out he had been convicted of raping two teenagers, and is a registered sex offenders, I regretted speaking to him.
